column3: {name: "Ellen, Senior Reactor Operator at the Reed Research Reactor", weight: "1.0"}

column4: description: "One hour dose limit for a member of the public from non medical sources",

column5: {statement: "(2) The dose in any unrestricted area from external sources, exclusive of the dose contributions from patients administered radioactive material and released in accordance with § 35.75, does not exceed 0.002 rem (0.02 millisievert) in any one hour.", source: "nrc1301"}

column4: description: "One year dose limit for a member of the public",

column5: {statement: "(1) The total effective dose equivalent to individual members of the public from the licensed operation does not exceed 0.1 rem (1 mSv) in a year, exclusive of the dose contributions from background radiation, from any administration the individual has received, from exposure to individuals administered radioactive material and released under § 35.75, from voluntary participation in medical research programs, and from the licensee's disposal of radioactive material into sanitary sewerage in accordance with § 20.2003, and", source: "nrc1301"}

column4: description: "Radiation worker one year dose limit",

column5: {statement: "(i) The total effective dose equivalent being equal to 5 rems (0.05 Sv)", source: "nrc1201"}

column4: description: "One year dose limit for radiation workers who are minors",

column5: {statement: "The annual occupational dose limits for minors are 10 percent of the annual dose limits specified for adult workers in § 20.1201.", source: "nrc1207"}

{statement: "(a) The licensee shall ensure that the dose equivalent to the embryo/fetus during the entire pregnancy, due to the occupational exposure of a declared pregnant woman, does not exceed 0.5 rem (5 mSv). (For recordkeeping requirements, see § 20.2106.)", source: "nrc1208"}

column4: description: "One hour dose limit for individials in restricted high radiation areas",

column5: {statement: "(1) A control device that, upon entry into the area, causes the level of radiation to be reduced below that level at which an individual might receive a deep-dose equivalent of 0.1 rem (1 mSv) in 1 hour at 30 centimeters from the radiation source or from any surface that the radiation penetrates;", source: "nrc16"}
